# The Doomsday Clock is at 5

Premier Kruschev,
please decide whether you want to [Escalate]{.h} the conflict
by defying Kennedy's wishes and sending your R-12 missiles by boat to Cuba
despite the US's threat of a blockade.

* If you [Escalate]{.h}, the chance of Nuclear War is 1/6.
Roll the Die below to see whether your escalation leads to annhililation.
If the die lands on a 6, then proceed to Nuclear War.
Otherwise proceed to Stage 3.

* If you [Stand Down]{.h},
you will be humiliated and will take the payoff according to what's written
on your role card.

Choose wisely!

[Escalate (move to Stage 3)](stage3.qmd){.btn .btn-outline-primary .btn role="button"}
[Escalate (Nuclear War)](NuclearWar.qmd){.btn .btn-outline-primary .btn role="button"}
[Stand Down](KennedyWin.qmd){.btn .btn-outline-primary .btn role="button"}

```{shinylive-r}
#| standalone: true
#| code-fold: false
#| label: randomizer
#| viewerHeight: 250

library(shiny)
library(shinyjs)

# Define UI with custom styles and shinyjs
ui <- fluidPage(
  useShinyjs(),  # Include shinyjs for dynamic UI updates
  titlePanel("Roll a Six-Sided Die"),
  
  tags$head(
    tags$style(HTML("
      #roll_button {
        background-color: #3498db;
        color: white;
        font-size: 20px;
        font-weight: bold;
        border-radius: 10px;
        border: none;
        padding: 15px 30px;
        transition: background-color 0.3s;
      }
      #roll_button:hover {
        background-color: #2980b9;
      }
      #die_result {
        font-size: 100px;
        color: #2c3e50;
        font-family: 'Arial', sans-serif;
        text-align: center;
        margin-top: 20px;
        border: 2px solid #34495e;
        border-radius: 10px;
        width: 120px;
        height: 120px;
        display: inline-block;
        line-height: 120px;
      }
    "))
  ),
  
  sidebarLayout(
    sidebarPanel(
      actionButton("roll_button", "Roll the Die")
    ),
    mainPanel(
      div(id = "die_result", "ðŸŽ²")  # Placeholder for die result
    )
  )
)

# Define server logic
server <- function(input, output, session) {
  # Observe button clicks
  observeEvent(input$roll_button, {
    # Show placeholder
    runjs("$('#die_result').html('â³');")
    
    # Delay for animation
    invalidateLater(10000, session)
    
    # Update with final die roll
    observe({
      die_roll <- sample(1:6, size = 1)  # Generate random number between 1 and 6
      runjs(sprintf("$('#die_result').html('%d');", die_roll))
    })
  })
}

# Run the application
shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)
```
